title: Thriae
data:
[![Wikipedia](/images/thumb/f/f8/Fair-use-wikipedia-logo.png/50px-Fair-use-wikipedia-logo.png)](/wiki/File:Fair-use-wikipedia-logo.png "Wikipedia")

[Wikipedia](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Main_Page "wikipedia:Main Page") has an article about:

***[Thriae](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Thriae "wikipedia:Thriae")***

**Thriae** are a type of monster in [dNetHack](/wiki/DNetHack "DNetHack") and in [SpliceHack](/wiki/SpliceHack "SpliceHack"). They have different stats in each variant.

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 dNetHack](#dNetHack)
  - [1.1 Generation](#Generation)
- [2 SpliceHack](#SpliceHack)
  - [2.1 Encyclopedia entry](#Encyclopedia_entry)
- [3 Origin](#Origin)

## dNetHack

| **Attacks**                                                     | Weapon 4d4 physical, Offhand Weapon 4d4 physical, Claw 0d0 [seduction](/wiki/Steal_item "Steal item"), Claw 0d0 [seduction](/wiki/Steal_item "Steal item"), Sting 4d4 [poison](/wiki/Poison "Poison") (strength) |

| **[Alignment](/wiki/Alignment#Monster_alignment "Alignment")**                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                               | 10 (lawful)                                                                                                                                                                                                      |
|                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              |                                                                                                                                                                                                                  |
| **[Frequency](/wiki/Monster_frequency "Monster frequency")** (by [normal means](/wiki/Normal_mechanism "Normal mechanism"))                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  | 0 (Not randomly generated)                                                                                                                                                                                       |

| **Resistances [conveyed](/wiki/Corpse "Corpse")**                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            | [cold](/wiki/Cold "Cold")                                                                                                                                                                                        |
|                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              |                                                                                                                                                                                                                  |
| A thriae:* can [fly](/wiki/Fly "Fly").
* has [a head, a couple of arms, and a torso](/wiki/Humanoid "Humanoid").
* is [omnivorous](/wiki/Omnivore "Omnivore").
* is not a valid [polymorphable](/wiki/Polymorph "Polymorph") form.
* is female.
* is normally generated [peaceful](/wiki/Peaceful "Peaceful").
* is [strong](/wiki/Strong "Strong").
* can pick up weapons and food.
* can pick up [magical items](/wiki/Magical_item "Magical item").
* can be seen through [infravision](/wiki/Infravision "Infravision").
* cannot be [tamed](/wiki/Scroll_of_taming "Scroll of taming"). |                                                                                                                                                                                                                  |

In dNetHack, thriae are a special type of shopkeeper. The appear as part of the [n](/wiki/Nymph_\(monster_class\) "Nymph (monster class)") class.

### Generation

Thriae only appear in the [law quest](/wiki/Law_quest_\(dNethack\) "Law quest (dNethack)") branch, and sell stat-boosting [food](/wiki/Food "Food").

|                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                             |                                                                                                          |

|                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                             |                                                                                                          |
| **[Resistances](/wiki/Resistance "Resistance")**                                                                                                                                                                                                                            | Poison                                                                                                   |
| **Resistances [conveyed](/wiki/Corpse "Corpse")**                                                                                                                                                                                                                           | Poison                                                                                                   |
|                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                             |                                                                                                          |
| A thriae:* can [fly](/wiki/Fly "Fly").
* has [a head, a couple of arms, and a torso](/wiki/Humanoid "Humanoid").
* [does not eat](/wiki/Inediate "Inediate"). (\*)
* is female.
* is normally generated [hostile](/wiki/Hostile "Hostile").
* can pick up weapons and food. |                                                                                                          |
|                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                             |                                                                                                          |
| **[Reference](/wiki/Source_code "Source code")**                                                                                                                                                                                                                            | [SpliceHack 1.1.0 monst.c L227](https://github.com/NullCGT/SpliceHack/blob/Spl-R-1.1.0/src/monst.c#L227) |

SpliceHack's thriae are in the [a](/wiki/Ant "Ant") class. They aren't guaranteed to appear on any special level, and are rarely generated.

### Encyclopedia entry

Trifling with bee maidens often leads to getting stung.

## Origin

In Greek mythology the thriae were nymphs: they had the head and torso of human women, and the lower body and wings of a bee. This is probably why they have seduction and stinging attacks in both dNetHack and SpliceHack.

[![This article describes a 3.4.3-based variant of NetHack. Click here for more information.](/images/5/5d/Nh343var-icon.png)](/wiki/NetHackWiki:Next_version "This article describes a 3.4.3-based variant of NetHack. Click here for more information.")
html:
Thriae

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search
Wikipedia has an article about:
Thriae

Thriae are a type of monster in dNetHack and in SpliceHack. They have different stats in each variant.

Contents

  • 1 dNetHack
    • 1.1 Generation
  • 2 SpliceHack
    • 2.1 Encyclopedia entry
  • 3 Origin

dNetHack

n thriae (No tile)
Difficulty 21
Attacks Weapon 4d4 physical, Offhand Weapon 4d4 physical, Claw 0d0 seduction, Claw 0d0 seduction, Sting 4d4 poison (strength)
n thriae (No tile)
Difficulty 21
Attacks

Weapon 4d4 physical, Offhand Weapon 4d4 physical, Claw 0d0 seduction, Claw 0d0 seduction, Sting 4d4 poison (strength)

Base level 15
Base experience 462
Speed 18
Base AC 0
Base MR 50
Alignment 10 (lawful)
Frequency (by normal means) 0 (Not randomly generated)
Genocidable No
Weight 1450
Nutritional value 400
Size medium
Resistances cold, sleep, poison, petrification
Resistances conveyed cold

A thriae:

  • can fly.
  • has a head, a couple of arms, and a torso.
  • is omnivorous.
  • is not a valid polymorphable form.
  • is female.
  • is normally generated peaceful.
  • is strong.
  • can pick up weapons and food.
  • can pick up magical items.
  • can be seen through infravision.
  • cannot be tamed.

In dNetHack, thriae are a special type of shopkeeper. The appear as part of the n class.

Generation

Thriae only appear in the law quest branch, and sell stat-boosting food.

SpliceHack

a thriae (No tile)
Difficulty 12
Attacks Weapon 1d6 physical, Sting 2d6 poison (drain strength), Claw 0d0 seduction
a thriae (No tile)
Difficulty 12
Attacks

Weapon 1d6 physical, Sting 2d6 poison (drain strength), Claw 0d0 seduction

Base level 10
Base experience ?
Speed 12
Base AC 0
Base MR 0
Alignment 0 (neutral)
Frequency (by normal means) 1 (Very rare)
Genocidable Yes
Weight 600
Nutritional value 300
Size Medium
Resistances Poison
Resistances conveyed Poison

A thriae:

  • can fly.
  • has a head, a couple of arms, and a torso.
  • does not eat. (*)
  • is female.
  • is normally generated hostile.
  • can pick up weapons and food.
Reference SpliceHack 1.1.0 monst.c L227

SpliceHack's thriae are in the a class. They aren't guaranteed to appear on any special level, and are rarely generated.

Encyclopedia entry

Trifling with bee maidens often leads to getting stung.

Origin

In Greek mythology the thriae were nymphs: they had the head and torso of human women, and the lower body and wings of a bee. This is probably why they have seduction and stinging attacks in both dNetHack and SpliceHack.

{{wikipedia|Thriae}}
'''Thriae''' are a type of monster in [[dNetHack]] and in [[SpliceHack]]. They have different stats in each variant.

 |weight=1450

In dNetHack, thriae are a special type of shopkeeper. The appear as part of the {{mcsl|n}} class.

===Generation===
Thriae only appear in the [[Law quest (dNethack)|law quest]] branch, and sell stat-boosting [[food]].

SpliceHack's thriae are in the [[ant|{{white|a}}]] class. They aren't guaranteed to appear on any special level, and are rarely generated.

==Origin==
In Greek mythology the thriae were nymphs: they had the head and torso of human women, and the lower body and wings of a bee. This is probably why they have seduction and stinging attacks in both dNetHack and SpliceHack.
